body: LGTM. cc @criccomini
@criccomini @nathanielvarona this build wasn't tested and it does not pass tests. Can this be fixed or reverted please?

#2542 is going to be merged. I'm not sure if adding BROKER_TRANSPORT_OPTIONS here makes sense, but I do think it is smarter to rebase against #2542 .

It might be smarter if we expose the whole dictionary to the config file instead, because we are basically replicating it here.
Woah, I saw the green thingy. How did it not run tests. Weird.
Reverting
Done.
@seancron if you want to re-open and fix test, go for it.
The Travis hook seems broken, all the last builds passed but github displays a failure. Do anyone know how to fix that ?

Definitely worth doing something to let the region (and any other BROKER_TRANSPORT_OPTIONS) get set on Celery-- else airflow can only deployed with SQS in us-east. Deploying with SQS is particularly useful because SQS queue size can be tied in to increasing/decreasing the size of an autoscaling group of airflow workers.
Test failed :(
@saguziel, thanks for your PR! By analyzing the history of the files in this pull request, we identified @mistercrunch, @bolkedebruin and @aoen to be potential reviewers.
LGTM after fixes
LGTM (and thanks)
@cjqian, thanks for your PR! By analyzing the history of the files in this pull request, we identified @yu-iskw, @TrevorEdwards and @alexvanboxel to be potential reviewers.

Perhaps the aws_hook (which uses boto3) should be promoted to core as well, given it should be super to all things AWS. Looking forward to this one, I am trying to create a generic DB to s3 operator and having some issues with the boto2 s3 hook.
This other PR makes a similar change to the aws_hook to add the "resource" type, so that the s3_hook can  be upgraded to using boto3: https://github.com/apache/incubator-airflow/pull/2532

I've also had issues with the boto(2) version of the S3 hook and am using boto3 otherwise.  I understand there is some backwards incompatibility from boto to boto3 but boto is barely maintained these days (vs boto3).  It would be great to see this promoted to a core component.
@criccomini Test failures are unrelated (Docker?) now. Good news integration tests for Celery have now been added (using rabbitmq)
@bbradbury I actually mean that it does not make sense to expose options 1-by-1 and instead we should move everything to airflow.cfg. This would allow any arbitrary changes and forward compatibility.
@dalupus, thanks for your PR! By analyzing the history of the files in this pull request, we identified @mistercrunch, @bolkedebruin and @aoen to be potential reviewers.
looks like this didn't get reverted or something.   All tests are failing now.
Looks like https://github.com/apache/incubator-airflow/pull/2411 is blowing up tests
Fixed that. Should now pass properly again (maybe needs a rebase)
I'd like to get it in first. But it needs to be rebased though. We can promote it afterwards.
@dalupus, thanks for your PR! By analyzing the history of the files in this pull request, we identified @criccomini, @fernandosjp and @demorenoc to be potential reviewers.

```
NameError: global name 'JenkinsHook' is not defined
```

That was an import problem in a old commit. For the 5 last builds, it was ok, but git hub stay stuck on a really old one (the last one is the 60 and all tests pass perfectly : https://travis-ci.org/moe-nadal-ck/incubator-airflow ). 
I'll try to close/re-open the PR once to see if it fixes the problem.

Finally found the problem, an import of LoggingMixing was refused when it was run from the master branch (run from my branch only were working, I don't know exactly why). I removed all the import for LoggingMixin as the logger is available in BaseOperator and now everything is fine :).

Error:

```
INFO  [alembic.runtime.migration] Running upgrade 127d2bf2dfa7 -> cc1e65623dc7, add max tries column to task instance
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/travis/build/apache/incubator-airflow/.tox/py34-cdh-airflow_backend_postgres/lib/python3.4/site-packages/sqlalchemy/engine/base.py", line 1182, in _execute_context
    context)
  File "/home/travis/build/apache/incubator-airflow/.tox/py34-cdh-airflow_backend_postgres/lib/python3.4/site-packages/sqlalchemy/engine/default.py", line 470, in do_execute
    cursor.execute(statement, parameters)
psycopg2.ProgrammingError: relation "task_instance" does not exist
LINE 2: FROM task_instance 
             ^
```

Looks like the failure is only happening in postgres. If anyone has encountered a similar case in the past, would love to get some insight, thanks!

Hey @apurvis don't be discouraged! This looks like an important change, just today someone had the same problem and was asking about it on Gitter and would really appreciate the PR being made ready for review & merging, so thanks for submitting it 👍 

You can sign up to the Jira without and permission or request. It's open https://issues.apache.org/jira/projects/AIRFLOW

What did you try when squashing gave you more commits? The top 2 answers here show good ways to do this. Using the soft reset method is probably simpler, in your case you want to get your local master up to date with this one,  then soft reset and redo your unstaged changes as a single commit, and then push it to your github fork again.  https://stackoverflow.com/questions/5189560/squash-my-last-x-commits-together-using-git
@Fokko I have made the changes as suggested. Can you please review this?

@bolkedebruin, @criccomini, you're the ones who have reviewed and merged Docker-related PRs in the (recent) past. Would you mind reviewing this? Happy to hear your thoughts. An alternative approach to implementing this would be to pass the `auth_config` as a dict directly but I like the explicit parameters a bit better.

@moe-nadal-ck Thanks for reporting. While writing Airflow-1611 I found that it is possible to end up with circular dependency imports. Also the `SalesforceHook` does not require an explicit import from the LoggingMixin, since this one is already available by the BaseHook. I'll look into this as part of ticket Airflow-1605.

To jump right in: I was wondering about the username and password being in plaintext on the operator. Normally we would use a hook with connection parameters for this that could be protected by a fernet key. I don’t know if that make sense here, but it seems a bit strange to me to keep passwords in the dag?

For my own use case I planned to read them in from environment variables, so I wouldn't mind the plaintext. Would the hook+connection parameters approach support having multiple Docker registries across different dags? If you can point me to an example of an operator that uses a hook, I'm happy to check whether that would work here.
Changing to "master" is causing merge conflicts which I don't know how to resolve. I'm working on a new PR against master.
LGTM
The PNG isn't used right? Should be removed.

One note about the PR. When I built the airflow library from master and tested it by making a request to GCP, it was sending the Airflow version string to Google, which was rejecting it because it was not a normal-looking version number. In order to get it to work, I temporarily changed the version in version.py to "1.10.0". With this change, it worked fine.
What was sending a Airflow version string?
Are we ready to merge this PR ? and if yes, can someone do it ? :D
Travis build failed this time..

Oh yeah, I added the PNG here so I could reference it as a screenshot for the PR, not for the actual stuff to be merged. Will remove.

About the version string, I didn't look into it that carefully, but I'm guessing it was like a user agent version string or something similar. It wasn't anything in my changes, some sort of pre-existing behavior.
